Docs.summary: Releases the resources used by the current instance of the class.

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool A_0) cil managed

Docs.param: to release managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Called by the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymReader.Dispose%2A> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymReader.Finalize%2A> methods to release the managed and unmanaged resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called only by the public <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymReader.Dispose%2A> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymReader.Finalize%2A> methods; do not call this method directly.

MemberSignature.Value: ~SymReader ();
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Finalize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method overrides <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A>. Application code should not call this method; an object's `Finalize` method is automatically invoked during garbage collection, unless finalization by the garbage collector has been disabled by a call to the <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.ISymbolDocument GetDocument (string url, Guid language, Guid languageVendor, Guid documentType);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.ISymbolDocument GetDocument(string url, valuetype System.Guid language, valuetype System.Guid languageVendor, valuetype System.Guid documentType) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL that identifies the document.
The document language. You can specify this parameter as <xref:System.Guid>. to indicate any language.
The identity of the vendor for the document language. You can specify this parameter as <xref:System.Guid> to indicate any language vendor.
The type of the document. You can specify this parameter as <xref:System.Guid> to indicate any document type.
Docs.summary: Gets a document specified by the URL for the document and optionally the language, language vendor, and type.
Docs.returns: The document with the specified URL if found in the symbol store, or if the document does not exist.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `language`, `languageVendor`, and `documentType` parameters are currently ignored.

public virtual void ReplaceSymbolStore (string fileName, IntPtr stream);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReplaceSymbolStore(string fileName, native int stream) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the file containing the symbol store, or if using an in-memory store.
The pointer to the input stream for the symbol store, or <xref:System.IntPtr> if using an on-disk store.
Docs.summary: Replaces the existing symbol store with a delta symbol store.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ReplaceSymbolStore is much like the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymReader.UpdateSymbolStore%2A> method, but the given delta acts as a complete replacement rather than an update.
Only one of the parameters, `fileName` or `stream`, needs to be specified. If `fileName` is specified, the symbol store is updated with the symbols in that file. If `stream` is specified, the symbol store is updated with the data from the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream> .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void UpdateSymbolStore (string fileName, IntPtr stream);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateSymbolStore(string fileName, native int stream) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the file containing the symbol store, or if using an in-memory store.
The pointer to the input stream for the symbol store, or <xref:System.IntPtr> if using an on-disk store.
Docs.summary: Updates the existing symbol store with a delta symbol store.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used in Edit and Continue scenarios as a way to update the symbol store to match deltas to the original PE file.
Only one of the parameters, `fileName` or `stream`, needs to be specified. If `fileName` is specified, the symbol store is updated with the symbols in that file. If `stream` is specified, the symbol store is updated with the data from the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream> .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymbolToken UserEntryPoint { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymbolToken UserEntryPoint

Docs.summary: Gets the metadata token for the method that was specified as the user entry point for the module, if any.
Docs.value: The metadata token for the method that is the user entry point for the module.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The return value is normally the main method.

Docs.exception: An entry point was not found.
